thought.text: Wait, this approach won't work because the issue is that `(-1)*B` doesn't print as `-B`, it prints as `(-1)*B`. The problem is in the MatMul printer, not the MatAdd printer. Let me check how MatMul prints:

action.command: cd /tmp/tmpj79ghnjj/sympy && python -c "from sympy import *; A = MatrixSymbol('A', 2, 2); B = MatrixSymbol('B', 2, 2); print(repr((-1)*B)); print(str((-1)*B))"

function.arguments: {"command": "cd /tmp/tmpj79ghnjj/sympy && python -c \"from sympy import *; A = MatrixSymbol('A', 2, 2); B = MatrixSymbol('B', 2, 2); print(repr((-1)*B)); print(str((-1)*B))\"", "security_risk": "MEDIUM"}
function.name: execute_bash
